summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to Alex Acosta, the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida, regarding the Epstein case. The sender is seeking approval to send out victim notification letters and to send copies to Mr. Josefsberg, likely a defense attorney.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida
persons.context: The recipient of the email, being asked for approval regarding victim notification procedures in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Mr. Josefsberg
persons.context: The sender asks if it is alright to send copies of the victim notification letter to him, indicating he is involved in the legal proceedings.

connections.description: Acosta is the prosecuting U.S. Attorney, while Josefsberg is likely a defense attorney for Epstein, placing them in an adversarial legal relationship.

keyFacts: The email is dated December 7, 2007, during the period of the federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
The correspondence shows U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta was directly involved in procedural decisions regarding victim notifications.
The email indicates victim notification letters were being prepared, a standard part of federal criminal proceedings.
The mention of Mr. Josefsberg suggests defense counsel was to be kept informed or copied on victim communications.
